summary: The document is a memorandum detailing a meeting between the Director of Central Intelligence (DCI) and Chairman Boland of the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI) on December 6, 1978. The discussion covered several sensitive topics including the Kampiles Case, a personal matter briefed to Chairman Boland and Chairman Bayh, the Iranian situation and intelligence failure, the involvement of HPSCI in Charters questions, and the Authorization Bill with hopes for an FOIA repealer and provisions for security personnel to carry guns. Additionally, the Chairman inquired about the CIA's involvement with SAVAK in Iran and any reports from Guyana regarding Jonestown.
key_findings: The DCI and Chairman Boland discussed sensitive information related to the Kampiles Case, agreeing not to brief other Committee members.
A personal matter was briefed to both Chairman Boland and Chairman Bayh.
The Iranian situation and a perceived intelligence failure were discussed, with the DCI clarifying the President's displeasure was not personal but about political reporting in general.
The DCI urged HPSCI to engage early in Charters questions to address potential differences between the Senate and the Administration.
Discussions included the Authorization Bill, focusing on an FOIA repealer and allowing security personnel to carry guns.
Chairman Boland inquired about the CIA's involvement with SAVAK in Iran and any reports from Guyana about Jonestown, with the CIA providing limited information post-incident.
